intro: Borreria stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Borreria stenophylla is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
